page.title: 07Farming in the Lune Valley.
page.content: Farms in this area rear mainly sheep or cows or both. The natural grass has been regularly re-seeded in some fields to improve the quality. Some farmers have given up milk cows altogether be- cause of milk quotas. The milk cows are Friesians and Aberdeen Angus are beef cows which are sold at auction in Lan- caster or Bentham. Normally sheep are kept outdoors all the year round and shorn in Spring, but one large farm winters about 450 sheep indoors,in an enormous shed, until after lambing. They shear them in December to prevent illness caused by sweating. In the past there were several varieties of sheep but nowadays mules are very popular. They are a cross between Swaledale and Hexham or Blueface/Leicester. Goats are kept in Arkholme and their produce sold.
